message.content:
cs.AR, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.DB, cs.NE 

The paper discusses the challenges and opportunities of processing-in-memory (PIM) architectures, which involve integrating computation into the memory subsystem to reduce data movement costs. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including architecture (cs.AR), distributed and parallel computing (cs.DC), software engineering (cs.SE), databases (cs.DB), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). The paper specifically focuses on identifying opportunities for PIM in real applications, programming these applications for PIM architectures, and addressing challenges for widespread adoption, which aligns with the concerns of these sub-categories.
